data.text: @JeremyVineOn5 Of course it is! Was it OK before they named it Covid?
@JeremyVineOn5 If you have vourerble people at home you should still be made to self isolated

@JeremyVineOn5 In other countries (notably NL) it has never been the law, just advice. UK is changing law to advice, the same as for any other contagious disease. Do the right thing for your coworkers, friends, citizens? . it's not difficult.

@JeremyVineOn5 Er.  Yes.  There might be someone who has a suppressed immune system.  Someone asked me if they wanted to give me a lift to work and I said no thanks you've had COVID.  She said you can't catch it of me, I've had 3 jabs.  🙄
@JeremyVineOn5 At some point there’s going to be another variant, we just have to pray that we cope it as well as we have omicron..,
@julietisamod @JudeMcKew @Blueeggontoast @JeremyVineOn5 Some protection loooool they were so concerned they partied away

@JudeMcKew @julietisamod @Blueeggontoast @JeremyVineOn5 According to the NHS my son is at high risk because he has special needs 🤣🤣🤣 even my son doesn't want it because thank God my child can think for himself!

@JudeMcKew @julietisamod @Blueeggontoast @JeremyVineOn5 Well if they was so much at high risk then shouldn't the NHS have been made to have the jab to protect u? And why now do care home staff no longer require it! U have been brainwashed sadly
@JeremyVineOn5 For those Co-workers with underlying health issues and others suffering from cancer such as myself and am still working - it would be selfish and potentially disasterous!!

@JudeMcKew @Shorty_88a @Blueeggontoast @JeremyVineOn5 Exactly! Boris isn’t immunosuppressed and so the vaccine offers him and his mates some protection.. for us it offers very little, and we don’t have our own immune systems in full operation to fight it.
